title: What’s the Difference Between Durian & Jackfruit?

steps.title: Durian is a tropical, smelly fruit with a custard-like pulp.
steps.content: Durian is a tropical, smelly fruit with a custard-like pulp. This fruit is infamous for its pungent smell and acquired taste. Durian naturally grows in Indonesia, the Philippines, Malaysia, and Thailand and is banned in many public places due to its foul odor. [1] X Research source The scientific name for a durian plant is Durio zibethinus . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Jackfruit is a tropical food that can be served as a fruit or vegetable.
steps.content: Jackfruit is a tropical food that can be served as a fruit or vegetable. This large and robust fruit is native to Asia and grows in wetlands. When jackfruit is green and unripe, it can be cooked as a vegetable. When it’s ripe, the sweetly acidic pulp can be enjoyed as a fruit. [3] X Research source The scientific name for jackfruit is Artocarpus heterophyllus . [4] X Research source

steps.title: Ripe durian is soft, while jackfruit is crunchy.
steps.content: Ripe durian is soft, while jackfruit is crunchy. These tropical fruits have a sweet taste when ripe, but their textures are very different. Jackfruits are fibrous and dense, whereas durians are creamy, like bananas. [5] X Research source Durian is said to taste like a mixture of cheese, almonds, caramel, and onion. Jackfruit is often described as tasting like a cross between mango and bananas, but its unripe form can easily take on other flavors. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Durian and jackfruit have pungent smells.
steps.content: Durian and jackfruit have pungent smells. These fruits are often banned from public transportation because of their foul odor. Durian is described as smelling like socks and sewer water, while jackfruit is compared to pineapple, banana, and rotten onions (depending on who you ask). [7] X Research source

steps.title: Jackfruit is the largest tree-borne fruit, while durian is the size of an apple.
steps.content: Jackfruit is the largest tree-borne fruit, while durian is the size of an apple. When comparing the two fruits, jackfruit is massive compared to durian (or any fruit). [8] X Research source Jackfruits can be 2 feet (61 cm) long and weigh 40 pounds (18 kg), whereas durians are typically 6 to 8 inches (15 to 20 cm) in size. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Durians are covered in spikes, while jackfruits have bumpy rinds.
steps.content: Durians are covered in spikes, while jackfruits have bumpy rinds. Apart from their size, the main way to visually tell these fruits apart is by their rough exteriors. Jackfruits have a bumpy and almost scaly outer shell, whereas durians are covered in needle-like spikes. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Unripe jackfruit can be used as a meat substitute, while durian cannot.
steps.content: Unripe jackfruit can be used as a meat substitute, while durian cannot. Jackfruit is a common staple for those within the vegan and vegetarian communities, thanks to its pork-like texture. When pulled apart, a jackfruit’s pulp becomes stringy and meaty. Because of this, jackfruit is often used to make savory dishes, such as “pork” or “chicken” tacos, sandwiches, or casseroles. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Jackfruit is high in protein, while durian has more fiber, carbs, and fats.
steps.content: Jackfruit is high in protein, while durian has more fiber, carbs, and fats. This is one of the reasons why jackfruit is an awesome meat substitute. Its protein-dense flesh can be more filling than a durian’s, as there’s about 1.9 g of protein per 100 g of ripe jackfruit. [12] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Durian and jackfruit seeds can be roasted and eaten.
steps.content: Durian and jackfruit seeds can be roasted and eaten. Although durian and jackfruit seeds cannot be eaten raw, they make a delicious snack when roasted. These seeds can be baked like pumpkin seeds with a little oil and salt. Keep in mind that jackfruit seeds are scattered amongst their flesh, while durian seeds are encapsulated in oval compartments surrounded by pulp.

steps.title: Durian and jackfruit are both packed with vitamins and minerals.
steps.content: Durian and jackfruit are both packed with vitamins and minerals. These smelly but delicious fruits are a great addition to any diet. Take a look at how they compare: Durian is high in copper, zinc, iron, and vitamin B. [13] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Jackfruit is high in calcium, potassium, and vitamins A and C.
